page.title: 01General Description 1
page.content: Moniaive is a very attractive village in the Nithdale District of Dumfriesshire.It lies at the junction of three glens down which flow CAIRN,Craigdarroch and Dalwhat Waters respectively.These merge and flow S.E.as the Cairn to join the River Nith just north of Dumfries,the main town of the region.The village itself is a very lovely place and many people come to live here because of this.Often this means that people who have holidayed here decide to retire here and,this in part,accounts for the population of approximately 850 having a majority of people over the age of 55.The primary school roll is 58,the secondary school roll is approximately 30 and there are roughly 25 pre school age children in the village.This may give an indication of various age groups within stressing the elderly.
